discussion.content:
Firstly, from answers listed, C is correct. 

That being said, RAS albeit a generic term used as per statement in the question, it would nevertheless be best practice to keep up to date with perpetual evolution (especially in a field such as network security) of technology (in general).

Hello RRAS:

'Routing and Remote Access Service (RRAS) is a Microsoft API and server software that makes it possible to create applications to administer the routing and remote access service capabilities of the operating system, to function as a network router. Developers can also use RRAS to implement routing protocols. 

The RRAS server functionality follows and builds upon the Remote Access Service (RAS) in Windows NT 4.0.[1] RRAS was introduced with Windows 2000 and offered as a download for Windows NT 4.0. '

Source:

Routing and Remote Access Service
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Routing_and_Remote_Access_Service

questions.question_text:
A technician needs to install a server to authenticate remote users before they have access to corporate network resources when working from home.
Which of the following servers should the technician implement?

While monitoring the network, a technician notices that the network traffic to one of the servers is extremely high.
Which of the following should the technician use to verify if this is a concern?

discussion.content: The correct answer is D - Real Time Monitoring as per it's defination and actions on monitoring a network performance in real time.

Even if answer C is technically correct, it would be a mistake to look for historical traffic patterns (i.e. base lines) only when encountering suspicious network traffic; just because a spike fits in to a historical pattern, doesn't mean that its not malevolent. Good security practices always comes in layers (there is a reason 'Defence in Depth' is a well-known coined term)...

Defense in depth (computing)
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Defense_in_depth_(computing)

questions.question_text:
A network administrator is following best practices to implement firewalls, patch management and policies on the network.
Which of the following should be performed to verify the security controls in place?

discussion.content:
Even though 'A' is correct, it's nevertheless only a part of the 'defence in depth' facet. 

Answer should also include 'D' (as an example as it listed here) with any new hardware and software setup.

Ergo, with the same possible answers, the question should be rephrased with 'choose two best answers'...

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a connectionless protocol? (Select TWO)

choices.C: PERMIT SRCIP:ANY SPORT:80 DSTIP:192.168.0.0/24 DPORT ANY

questions.question_text:
A network technician wants to allow HTTP traffic through a stateless firewall. The company uses the 192.168.0.0/24 network.
Which of the following ACL should the technician configure? (Select TWO)
